Hi Samir,

Thank you so much for the confirmation

I just wanted to pause and double-check the numbers first, as I know you want to be careful about staying within the monthly limit.

Currently, we’ve used 82 minutes of your 120-minute allowance. That leaves us with 38 minutes remaining for the month.

Since we need about 60 minutes to configure the firewall rules safely, proceeding now would tip us slightly over the cap, resulting in an overage of about 22 minutes.

Are you happy for me to go ahead with that extra time to get this sorted for you today? Just let me know what works best for you!

Hi Allie,

Hi Samir,

We’ve scoped out the specific configurations required to get that balance right for Design Tiles. To safely implement these Cloudflare rules, ensuring we keep Meta and Google happy while throttling those aggressive bots, this will take 60 minutes.

This time includes setting up the firewall rules and running the necessary tests to make sure your ad campaigns and SEO performance continue.

Just let us know, and we will get this sorted for you immediately.

Hi Samir,

We will investigate the specific configurations required to achieve the balance you described, specifically ensuring Meta and Google crawlers remain accessible while rate-limiting the aggressive bots.

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena

full_threads.body:
Hi Samir,

Thanks for the very detailed and helpful guidance - that makes perfect sense, especially ensuring Meta/Facebook and Google remain fully accessible for your active ad campaigns and SEO.

Looping in @Wolf IQ Support here - they will now investigate the exact Cloudflare configurations needed to implement this setup (allowing essential crawlers, rate-limiting aggressive bots, and blocking suspicious traffic) and confirm the solution with you shortly.

Cheers,
Andy

On Thu, Nov 27, 2025 at 6:23 AM support <support@designtiles.com.au> wrote:
Hi Andy,

Thanks for the update - appreciate the extra detail.
Given we're currently running active Facebook and Instagram ads, I just want to make sure any hosting-side changes don't interfere with ad delivery, link previews, or the website's general accessibility.
Would it be possible for your team to look into the following:
  1. Re-enable Cloudflare, but configure it so that essential crawlers like Facebook's (facebookexternalhit) and Googlebot remain allowed.
  2. Rate-limit AhrefsBot and any other aggressive crawlers so they aren't hitting the site thousands of times per day.
  3. Block or challenge unknown/suspicious bots, especially anything that's clearly automated but not essential.
  4. Keep anything related to Meta/Facebook and Google fully accessible, since these are required for our ads and SEO.
This should help protect the site and reduce the inflated bot traffic without impacting our marketing activity.
Please let me know if this setup works from your side or if you recommend an alternative approach.
Thank you


Samir Bhatta
IT Support

Phone: (02) 9567 8971
Website: www.designtiles.com.au
Showroom: 407 Princes Highway, Rockdale, NSW 2216



Proudly Supporting


IMPORTANT: The contents of the email and any attachments are confidential.They are intended for the named recipients(s) only. If you have received this email by mistake, please notify the sender immediately and do not disclose the contents to anyone or make copies thereof.








From: Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au>
Sent: Wednesday, November 26, 2025 12:14 PM
To: support <support@designtiles.com.au>
Cc: Allie B. <allie@wolfiq.com.au>; Joel M. <joel@wolfiq.com.au>
Subject: Blocking unwanted traffic on Design Tiles | Wolf IQ
Hi Samir,

We hope you're doing well.

I wanted to provide some more context on the cloudflare last week.

Since October 2025, there has been an unusual spike in visits to many of our customer websites. Much of this traffic was coming from automated bots such as AhrefsBot, facebookexternalhit and other unknown crawlers.

This traffic has caused problems including skewed analytics data, increased server load, SEO issues, security risks, misleading conversion metrics, higher operational costs, API misuse, and spam-related compliance issues.

Ahrefs and Facebook for example are visiting the Design Tiles' website >1,000 times per day and to help keep the website safe and within T&C limits, we installed Cloudflare and then removed it after your note on November 21.

We're looking into what else is possible and will come back to you with a proposal before changing.

Thanks,
Andy


--

Andy Crebar

Director
0480 801 428
andy@wolfiq.com
